00071 /* defines.h contains definitions of device registers etc */
00072 #include <inttypes.h>
00073 #include <avr/eeprom.h>
00074 #include <avr/sfr_defs.h>
00075 #include <avr/io.h>
00076 #include <avr/wdt.h>
00077 // Definitions of AT90S2313 registers and other characteristics
00078 #include "defines.h"
00079 // Function prototypes and pin allocations
00080 #include "serial-programmer-at90s2313.h"
00081 #include <util/delay.h>
00082 /* functions to send/receive */
00083 #include "serial.h"
00084 
00085 #define TRUE 1
00086 #define FALSE 0
00087 /* Convenience macros (we don't use them all) */
00088 #define  _BV(bit) (1 << (bit))
00089 #define  inb(sfr) _SFR_BYTE(sfr)
00090 #define  inw(sfr) _SFR_WORD(sfr)
00091 #define  outb(sfr, val) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) = (val))
00092 #define  outw(sfr, val) (_SFR_WORD(sfr) = (val))
00093 #define  cbi(sfr, bit) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) &= ~_BV(bit))
00094 #define  sbi(sfr, bit) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) |= _BV(bit))
00095 #define  high(x) ((uint8_t) (x >> 8) & 0xFF)
00096 #define  low(x) ((uint8_t) (x & 0xFF))
00097 
00098 /***************************************************************************************/
00116 // Define the parts to be stored into EEPROM.
00117 #define NUMPARTS 8
00118 uint8_t part[NUMPARTS][6] = {
00119 /* Sig 2, Sig 3, FPage, EPage, Busy, Lock/Fuse */
00120 {   0x91,  0x09,   16,    0,   FALSE,  0x77     },  // ATTiny26
00121 {   0x91,  0x0A,   16,    4,   TRUE,   0xFF     },  // ATTiny2313
00122 {   0x92,  0x05,   32,    4,   TRUE,   0xFF     },  // ATMega48
00123 {   0x93,  0x08,   32,    0,   FALSE,  0x77     },  // ATMega8535
00124 {   0x93,  0x0A,   32,    4,   TRUE,   0xFF     },  // ATMega88
00125 {   0x94,  0x03,   64,    4,   TRUE,   0x77     },  // ATMega16
00126 {   0x94,  0x06,   64,    4,   TRUE,   0xFF     },  // ATMega168
00127 {   0x95,  0x02,   64,    0,   FALSE,  0x77     }   // ATMega32
00128 };
00129 /***************************************************************************************/
00130 
00131 uint16_t address;                    // Address to program
00132 unsigned char command;               // received instruction character
00133 uint16_t tempInt;
00134 uint8_t lsbAddress;
00135 uint8_t msbAddress;
00136 uint8_t buffer[4];                   // Buffer to store response from target
00137 uint8_t fPageSize;
00138 uint8_t ePageSize;
00139 uint8_t canCheckBusy;
00140 uint8_t lfCapability;
00141 uint8_t received;
00142 
00143 int main(void)
00144 {
00145 
00146 /*  Initialise hardware timers and ports. All start off as inputs */
00152     outb(DDRB,((inb(DDRB) & 0x08) | 0xBB));             // Keep PB2 free only
00153     outb(PORTB,(inb(PORTB) | 0xBB));
00154     sbi(ACSR,7);                                        // Turn off Analogue Comparator
00155     initbootuart();                                     // Initialize UART.
00156     uint8_t sigByte1=0;                                 // Target Definition defaults
00157     uint8_t sigByte2=0;
00158     uint8_t sigByte3=0;
00159     uint8_t fuseBits=0;
00160     uint8_t highFuseBits=0;
00161     uint8_t extendedFuseBits=0;
00162     uint8_t lockBits=0;
00163 
00164 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00165 /* Main loop. We exit this only with an "E" command. */
00166     {
00167         for(;;)
00168         {
00169             command=recchar();                          // Loop and wait for command character.
00170 
00174             if (command=='a')
00175             {
00176                 sendchar('Y');                          // Yes, we will autoincrement.
00177             }
00178 
00182             else if (command=='A')                       // Set address
00183             {
00184                 address = (recchar()<<8);               // Set address high byte first.
00185                 address |= recchar();                   // Then low byte.
00186                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00187             }
00188 
00195            else if (command=='b')
00196             {
00197                 uint16_t blockLength = ((uint16_t)fPageSize<<1);
00198                 if (fPageSize > 0) sendchar('Y');       // Report block load supported.
00199                 else sendchar('N');
00200                 sendchar(high(blockLength));            // MSB first.
00201                 sendchar(low(blockLength));             // Report FLASH pagesize (bytes).
00202             }
00203 
00205             else if (command=='p')
00206             {
00207                 sendchar('S');                          // Answer 'SERIAL'.
00208             }
00209 
00211             else if (command=='S')
00212             {
00213                 sendchar('A');
00214                 sendchar('V');                          // ID always 7 characters.
00215                 sendchar('R');
00216                 sendchar('S');
00217                 sendchar('P');
00218                 sendchar('R');
00219                 sendchar('G');
00220             }
00221 
00223             else if (command=='V')
00224             {
00225                 sendchar('0');
00226                 sendchar('0');
00227             }
00228 
00231             else if(command=='t')
00232             {
00233                 sendchar( 0 );                          // Send list terminator.
00234             }
00235 
00237             else if (command=='x')
00238             {
00239                 recchar();                              // Discard sent value
00240                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00241                 cbi(PORTB,LED);
00242             }
00243 
00245             else if (command=='y')
00246             {
00247                 recchar();                              // Discard sent value
00248                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00249                 sbi(PORTB,LED);
00250             }
00251 
00253 // We are not currently using this (as information is lacking).
00254             else if (command=='T')
00255             {
00256                 recchar();                              // Discard sent value
00257                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00258             }
00259 
00266             else if (command=='P')
00267             {
00268                 uint8_t retry = 10;
00269                 uint8_t result = 0;
00270                 while ((result != 0x53) && (retry-- > 0))
00271                 {
00272                     cbi(PORTB,SCK);                     // Set serial clock low
00273                     sbi(PORTB,RESET);                   // Pulse reset line off
00274                     _delay_us(100);                     // Delay to let CPU know that programming will occur
00275                     cbi(PORTB,RESET);                   // Pulse reset line on
00276                     _delay_us(25000);                   // 25ms delay
00277                     writeCommand(0xAC,0x53,0x00,0x00);  // "Start programming" command
00278                     result=buffer[2];
00279                 }
00282                 writeCommand(0x30,0x00,0x00,0x00);
00283                 sigByte1 = buffer[3];
00284                 writeCommand(0x30,0x00,0x01,0x00);
00285                 sigByte2 = buffer[3];
00286                 writeCommand(0x30,0x00,0x02,0x00);      // Signature Bytes
00287                 sigByte3 = buffer[3];
00288 /* Check for device support. If the first signature byte is not 1E, then the device is
00289 either not an Atmel device, is locked, or is not responding.*/
00290                 uint8_t found=FALSE;                    // Indicates if the target device is supported
00291                 uint8_t partNo = 0;
00292                 if (sigByte1 == 0x1E)
00293                 {
00294                     while ((partNo < NUMPARTS) && (! found))
00295                     {
00296                         found = ((part[partNo][0] == sigByte2) && (part[partNo][1] == sigByte3));
00297                         partNo++;
00298                     }
00299                 }
00300                 if (found)
00301                 {
00302                     partNo--;
00303                     sendchar('\r');
00304                     fPageSize = part[partNo][2];
00305                     ePageSize = part[partNo][3];
00306                     canCheckBusy = part[partNo][4];
00307                     lfCapability = part[partNo][5];
00308                     buffer[3] = 0;                      // In case we cannot read these
00309                     if (lfCapability & 0x08) writeCommand(0x50,0x08,0x00,0x00);  // Read Extended Fuse Bits
00310                     extendedFuseBits = buffer[3];
00311                     if (lfCapability & 0x04) writeCommand(0x58,0x08,0x00,0x00);  // Read High Fuse Bits
00312                     highFuseBits = buffer[3];
00313                     if (lfCapability & 0x02) writeCommand(0x50,0x00,0x00,0x00);  // Read Fuse Bits
00314                     fuseBits = buffer[3];
00315                     if (lfCapability & 0x01) writeCommand(0x58,0x00,0x00,0x00);  // Read Lock Bits
00316                     lockBits = buffer[3];
00317                 }
00318                 else
00319                 {
00320                     sendchar('?');                      // Device cannot be programmed
00321                     sbi(PORTB,RESET);                   // Lift reset line
00322                 }
00323             }
00324 
00326             else if(command=='L')
00327             {
00328                 sbi(PORTB,RESET);                       // Pulse reset line off
00329                 sendchar('\r');                         // Answer OK.
00330             }
00331 
00334             else if (command=='e')
00335             {
00336                 writeCommand(0xAC,0x80,0x00,0x00);      // Erase command
00337                 pollDelay(FALSE);
00338                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00339             }
00340 
00342             else if (command=='R')
00343             {
00346                 lsbAddress = low(address);
00347                 msbAddress = high(address);
00348                 writeCommand(0x28,msbAddress,lsbAddress,0x00);  // Read high byte
00349                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00350                 writeCommand(0x20,msbAddress,lsbAddress,0x00);  // Read low byte
00351                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00352                 address++;                              // Auto-advance to next Flash word.
00353             }
00354 
00358             else if (command=='c')
00359             {
00360                 received = recchar();
00361                 writeCommand(0x40,0x00,address & 0x7F,received);    // Low byte
00362                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00363             }
00364 
00368             else if (command=='C')
00369             {
00370                 received = recchar();
00371                 writeCommand(0x48,0x00,address & 0x7F,received);    // High Byte
00372                 address++;                              // Auto-advance to next Flash word.
00373                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00374             }
00375 
00381             else if (command== 'm')
00382             {
00383                 writeCommand(0x4C,(address>>8) & 0x7F,address & 0xE0,0x00);  // Write Page
00384                 pollDelay(TRUE);                        // Short delay
00385                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00386             }
00390             else if (command == 'D')
00391             {
00392                 lsbAddress = low(address);
00393                 msbAddress = high(address);
00394                 writeCommand(0xC0,msbAddress,lsbAddress,recchar());     // EEPROM byte
00395                 address++;                              // Auto-advance to next EEPROM byte.
00396                 pollDelay(FALSE);                       // Long delay
00397                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00398             }
00399 
00401             else if (command == 'd')
00402             {
00403                 lsbAddress = low(address);
00404                 msbAddress = high(address);
00405                 writeCommand(0xA0,msbAddress,lsbAddress, 0x00);
00406                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00407                 address++;                              // Auto-advance to next EEPROM byte.
00408             }
00409 
00412             else if (command=='B')
00413             {
00414                 tempInt = (recchar()<<8);               // Get block size high byte first.
00415                 tempInt |= recchar();                   // Low Byte.
00416                 sendchar(BlockLoad(tempInt,recchar(),&address));  // Block load.
00417             }
00418 
00421             else if (command=='g')
00422             {
00423                 tempInt = (recchar()<<8);               // Get block size high byte first.
00424                 tempInt |= recchar();                   // Low Byte.
00425                 command = recchar();                    // Get memory type
00426                 BlockRead(tempInt,command,&address);    // Block read
00427             }
00429             else if (command=='r')
00430             {
00431                 sendchar(lockBits);
00432             }
00433 
00435             else if (command=='l')
00436             {
00437                 if (lfCapability & 0x10) writeCommand(0xAC,0xE0,0x00,recchar());
00438                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00439             }
00440 
00442             else if (command=='F')
00443             {
00444                 sendchar(fuseBits);
00445             }
00446 
00448             else if (command=='f')
00449             {
00450                 if (lfCapability & 0x20) writeCommand(0xAC,0xA0,0x00,recchar()); // Fuse byte
00451                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00452             }
00453 
00455             else if (command=='N')
00456             {
00457                 sendchar(highFuseBits);
00458             }
00459 
00461             else if (command=='n')
00462             {
00463                 if (lfCapability & 0x40) writeCommand(0xAC,0xA8,0x00,recchar()); // High Fuse byte
00464                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00465             }
00466 
00468             else if (command=='Q')
00469             {
00470                 sendchar(extendedFuseBits);
00471             }
00472 
00474             else if (command=='q')
00475             {
00476                 if (lfCapability & 0x80) writeCommand(0xAC,0xA4,0x00,recchar()); // Extended Fuse byte
00477                 sendchar('\r');                         // Send OK back.
00478             }
00479 
00481             else if (command=='s')
00482             {
00483                 sendchar(sigByte3);
00484                 sendchar(sigByte2);
00485                 sendchar(sigByte1);
00486             }
00487 
00493             else if (command=='E')
00494             {
00495                 sendchar('\r');
00496                 sbi(PORTB,RESET);                       // Pulse reset line off
00497                 cbi(PORTB,PASSTHROUGH);                 // Change to serial passthrough
00498                 for (;;) asm("nop");                    // Spin endlessly
00499             }
00500 
00505             else if (command!=0x1b) sendchar('?');       // If not ESC, then it is unrecognized
00506         }
00507     }
00508 }
00509 
00510 /********************************************************************************/
00536 unsigned char BlockLoad(uint16_t size, unsigned char mem, uint16_t *address)
00537 {
00538     uint16_t blockCount = 0;
00539     uint16_t pageOffset = 0;
00540     uint16_t pageMask;
00541     if (mem=='E')
00542         pageMask = ((uint16_t)ePageSize-1);
00543     else if (mem=='F')
00544         pageMask = ((uint16_t)fPageSize-1);
00545     else return '?';                                        // Invalid Type
00546     uint16_t pageAddress = (*address) & (~pageMask);        // Upper bits identify page
00547     do
00548     {
00549         uint8_t lsbAddress = (*address) & pageMask;         // Address within page
00550         if (mem=='E')
00551         {
00552             if (ePageSize == 0)                             // Check Page Capability
00553             {
00554                 writeCommand(0xC0,0x00,lsbAddress,recchar());   // Get and write EEPROM byte direct
00555                 pollDelay(FALSE);                           // Long wait for completion of write command
00556             }
00557             else
00558                 writeCommand(0xC1,0x00,lsbAddress,recchar());   // Get and write EEPROM byte to its page
00559             blockCount+=1;
00560         }
00561         else
00562         {
00563             writeCommand(0x40,0x00,lsbAddress,recchar());   // FLASH Low byte
00564             writeCommand(0x48,0x00,lsbAddress,recchar());   // FLASH High Byte
00565             if (fPageSize == 0) pollDelay(TRUE);            // Short wait for completion of write command
00566             blockCount+=2;
00567         }
00568         (*address)++;                                       // Select next byte/word location.
00569 // Commit page. If paged writes are not used, skip this section. All writing is completed above.
00570         if (!(((mem=='E') && (ePageSize == 0)) || ((mem=='F') && (fPageSize == 0))))
00571         {
00572             pageOffset++;                                   // Check if a page is ready to commit
00573             if ((pageOffset > pageMask) || (blockCount >= size))
00574             {
00575                 if (mem=='E')
00576                 {
00577                     writeCommand(0xC2,high(pageAddress),low(pageAddress),0x00); // Commit EEPROM Page
00578                     pollDelay(FALSE);                       // Long wait for completion of commit command
00579                 }
00580                 else
00581                 {
00582                     writeCommand(0x4C,high(pageAddress),low(pageAddress),0x00); // Commit FLASH Page
00583                     pollDelay(TRUE);                        // Short wait for completion of commit command
00584                 }
00585                 pageAddress = (*address) & (~pageMask);     // next page
00586                 pageOffset = 0;                             // Restore counter for next page
00587             }
00588         }
00589     }
00590     while (blockCount < size);
00591     return '\r';
00592 }
00593 
00594 /***************************************************************************************/
00611 void BlockRead(unsigned int size, unsigned char mem, uint16_t *address)
00612 {
00613     {
00614         for(uint16_t n=0; n < size; n+=2)
00615         {
00616             lsbAddress = low(*address);
00617             msbAddress = high(*address);
00618             if (mem=='E')
00619                 writeCommand(0xA0,msbAddress,lsbAddress,0x00);  // EEPROM Byte
00620             else
00621             {
00622                 writeCommand(0x20,msbAddress,lsbAddress,0x00);  // FLASH Low Byte
00623                 sendchar(buffer[3]);
00624                 writeCommand(0x28,msbAddress,lsbAddress,0x00);  // FLASH High Byte
00625             }
00626             sendchar(buffer[3]);
00627             (*address)++;                                       // Select next FLASH word
00628         }
00629     }
00630 }
00631 
00632 /***************************************************************************************/
00644 uint8_t writeByte(const uint8_t datum)
00645 {
00646     uint8_t value = datum;
00647     uint8_t response = 0;
00648     for (uint8_t n=0; n < 8;  n++)
00649     {
00650         outb(PORTB,(inb(PORTB) & ~_BV(MOSI))|((value & 0x80)>>(7-MOSI)));// Shift data MSB and put to MISO pin
00651         _delay_us(1);               // Give him some time to settle
00652         sbi(PORTB,SCK);             // Raise SCK to latch output data
00653         _delay_us(1);               // Give him some time to settle
00654         response <<= 1;             // Prepare response for next input bit
00655         response |= (inb(PINB) & _BV(MISO))>>MISO;    // Add in next bit read
00656         cbi(PORTB,SCK);             // Drop SCK ready for next time
00657         value <<= 1;                // Move to expose next bit
00658     }
00659     return response;
00660 }
00661 
00662 /***************************************************************************************/
00677 void writeCommand(const uint8_t cmd, const uint8_t parm1, const uint8_t parm2, const uint8_t parm3)
00678 {
00679     buffer[0] = writeByte(cmd);
00680     buffer[1] = writeByte(parm1);
00681     buffer[2] = writeByte(parm2);
00682     buffer[3] = writeByte(parm3);
00683 }
00684 /***************************************************************************************/
00699 void pollDelay(const uint8_t shortDelay)
00700 {
00701     if (canCheckBusy)
00702     {
00703         do writeCommand(0xF0,0x00,0x00,0x00);           // This needs several ms, so
00704         while (buffer[3] & 0x01);                       // Wait for busy flag to drop
00705     }
00706     else
00707     {
00708         if (shortDelay) _delay_us(4500);
00709         else _delay_us(9000);
00710     }
00711 }
